creator: hg@apteryx.fr
text:
Tables spanning multiple pages sometimes show an extra row / extra border at the
end of the page. See attached example. 
The problem seems linked to the presence of empty cells.

Thanks for reporting the bug. Funny that the same problem has been reported
several times recently. Looks like the issue is more urgent than I thought.

Other references:
http://mail-archives.apache.org/mod_mbox/xmlgraphics-fop-users/200710.mbox/%3c26DB90BE942D3942ABCB5D8B82BD8B9331A9D4@exchange01.trax.aero%3e
http://mail-archives.apache.org/mod_mbox/xmlgraphics-fop-users/200710.mbox/%3cF0BC0D1F785C0145B6BA3DFE82BCEE0406F0CE6A@LNGDAYEXCP01VA.legal.regn.net%3e

Summary: when a row contains an empty cell, all of the break elements generated
for this row have a 900 penalty, leading to all sorts of strange results.
creator: vhennebert@gmail.com
gadams@apache.org
text: batch transition pre-FOP1.0 resolved+fixed bugs to closed+fixed
